items.title: Tablet Command, Inc.: iOS Developer
items.content:
iOS Developer

Posted Feb 6

Tablet Command, Inc.
Headquarters: San Francisco Bay Area
http://tabletcommand.com/jobs/ios-developer/

Remote: Pacific, Alaska, Central, Australia (Melbourne +/-1h)

Description

Tablet Command is the next generation incident management application for public safety and emergency responders. The iPad app brings an intuitive, easy to use, robust application to first responders for notification, situational awareness and incident management.

Tablet Command Enterprise Service is in use by thousands of fire service professionals spanning 100’s of fire departments across North America. Our premiere users include San Francisco, Stockton, Miramar (FL), San Bernardino County, San Diego City, Denver and San Mateo County.

Tablet Command is based in the San Francisco Bay Area and we all work remotely – across multiple time zones. Preferred time zones are Pacific, Alaska, Central, Australia.

Requirements

The best candidate will have strong communication skills and a passion for mobile development, software engineering and great UX design, as well as an enthusiastic attitude and a willingness to learn and keep up with new technology and trends.

As a part of a small, collaborative and agile tech team, be a primary contributor to the design and development of new mobile applications and features. Build, test, debug and maintain the application software throughout the product lifecycle.

Please provide in your application an example of something you’ve created and are proud of. This can be anything you choose: an app you’ve built, some code, a blog post, a pull request, or whatever you like.

Nice-to-haves include:

  • 3-4 years of professional experience with iOS (Swift, Objective-C)
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms
  • Experience with RESTful API
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across team
  • Action-oriented, diligent, and flexible
  • Passion for public safety and mission-critical software

Benefits

We’re committed to Tablet Command being a company where the best developers want to work, so we run an operating system (with credit to Joel Spolsky) known as “making a company where the best developers want to work,” or, in simpler terms, treating people well. This operating system applies to the physical layer (allowing remote work, family-friendly policies, reasonable work hours), the presentation layer (clean and pragmatic programming practices, pushing decisions down to the team, hiring smart people and letting them get things done, and a commitment to inclusion and professional development). But most importantly, the human layer, where no matter what we do, it’s guided first and foremost by an obsession over being fair, humane, kind, and treating each other like family.

Here are some of the other benefits you can expect working for Tablet Command:

  • Opportunity to work on high profile apps that make a difference
  • Work with an awesome dedicated group of people who are passionate about technology and public safety
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Generous Vacation Policy

Apply for this position

If you think we are a good fit for each other, submit your resume along with a cover letter to jobs @ tabletcommand.com, letting us know why you want this job and why you are the perfect fit for us.

items.title: Remote Year: Group Travel Specialist
items.content:
Group Travel Specialist

Posted Feb 6

Remote Year
Headquarters: Remote
www.remoteyear.com

Role Description

The Remote Year Travel team manages all “group travel” services (monthly transitions between RY cities) for hundreds of RY customers each month in groups of 40-80 people, as well as “individual travel” services such as side trips, deviations, and upgrades/extras.  Most of our team’s current focus is on air travel, although we manage some ground transfers already, and our scope is growing.  We are a licensed travel agency, providing services exclusively to RY and its customers.

This is a key role supporting the Travel Director with the planning and administration of all group travel execution, including: group flight bookings, pre-transition logistics, communications (internally and with customers), budget forecasting and financial tracking, etc.  Initially the role will be a skilled individual contributor; over time (with program growth) a small team is likely to be built around group travel services, and a top performer will have the possibility to develop as a team manager.  This role can be based anywhere.

Responsibilities:

  • Search and calculate optimal routing and travel fares for group travel based on specific preferences.
  • Manage the booking process for group travel from quote collection through to issuing tickets.
  • Ensure all group travel is within budget.
  • Accurately track all financials in relation to the group travel bookings.
  • Develop and maintain relationships with the airlines to build towards strong partnerships which will help Remote Year to exceed its goals.
  • Assist in pre-travel arrangements, including flight check-ins and seat selection.
  • Manage and reply to relevant travel change requests from Remotes directly.
  • Research and propose relevant “ extras” to improve the travel experience.
  • Manage and grow the routing database for the team to ensure we have up to date information to base itinerary decisions off.
  • Assist with internal travel bookings for other staff.
  • Manage our corporate mileage accounts ensuring we are using them to their best potential.

What You Bring

  • Minimum of 3 years experience in one or more of the following: travel industry (airline, corporate travel, or travel agency preferred), hospitality, and/or customer service.
  • Budgeting experience- ability to build, track and beat budgets.
  • Data skills -  amazing attention to detail and confidence in dealing with large amounts of numerical and non-numerical data.
  • Organization skills – great time management skills, ability to multitask.
  • Communications skills - ability to handle multiple, constant communication channels; ability to effectively communicate with program teams and with customers directly.

Nice to Have:

  • Experience negotiating group contracts with travel service providers (ideally airlines)
  • Experience with GDS platforms (ideally w/ Amadeus)
  • Extensive personal travel experience

Apply for this position

Please submit your resume and your cover letter here https://remote-year.breezy.hr/

items.title: iOS Engineer (RxSwift) at Heetch (Paris, France)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Carsharing, Marketplace, Transportation
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

*** We offer flexible and full remote work over Europe which means you can be based in Paris or anywhere else you want in Europe like 90% of our tech team.
Also, speaking french is mandatory for that position especially.
We are still a young structure and and we are not ready to work with people outside EU but will keep you posted on that ;)***

Simply put, we aim at offering the most playful ridesharing experience for party-goers, and the most satisfying night out for drivers. Our app is the centerpiece of the whole service, where drivers are able to get ride requests, where passengers are able to request rides, and where everyone is able to get in touch with us directly at anytime.

We don’t want to see our users open up Heetch just because we can get them from point A to point B, we want them to open the app because they feel like it was specifically built for them. We want to build upon our core service everything that would make every ride enjoyable. Whether it’s helping them put the music passengers want to listen to, help drivers find the right spots to go to and the right ride, give recommandations about places passengers would want to go, and it’s all open for anyone to suggest.

OUR ENGINEERING VALUES

  • Move smart: we are data driven, and employ tools and best practices to ship code quickly and safely (continuous integration, code review, automated testing, etc).
  • Distribute knowledge: we want to scale our engineering team to a point where our contributions do not stop at the company code base. We believe in the Open Source culture and communication with the outside world.
  • Leave code better than you found it: because we constantly raise the bar.
  • Unity makes strength: moving people from A to B is not as easy as it sounds but, we always keep calm and support each other.
  • Always improve: we value personal progress and want you to look back proudly on what you’ve done.

MOBILE AT HEETCH

Our app is one of the few mobile apps that run in the foreground for up to seven hours straight on drivers phones. This rather unique use case brings fun challenges with handling the lifecycle of the app.

  • Network and GPS management: we need to provide accurate information and price suggestions to our community. This means making sure every driver gets important notifications in any network conditions, provide as accurate as possible GPS localisation for the pricing and tracking.
  • UI & UX: Ride sharing apps are a really special case in app design. They all revolve around a map and the conventional navigation patterns like list view and navigation controls need heavy tweaking to make for a great user experience.
  • One way data flow and functional pattern: we are passionate about software architecture. We’ve built the core of our apps using Rx and want to push this forward in both the data and the UI layers. Ideally, our team will grow big enough that we’ll be able to push forward what doing mobile programming means and we’ll contribute back to all those amazing open source projects we learned from.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Build new exciting features.
  • Solve challenging real-time synchronization problems.
  • Build a robust & modern in-house framework, that will serve our app for next 4 years
  • Practise continuous refactoring and unit testing to constantly improve the codebase.
  • Create custom UI components (with Playground Driven Development)
  • Work on our great shiny redesign of the app.
  • Experimenting with various concepts (Coordinators/Flows, ReSwift)

REQUIREMENTS

  • Great oral and written communication skills.
  • Speaking both French and English at a conversational level
  • At least 4-5 years of experience with both Objective C and Swift in production environments.
  • Experience with creating and supporting a widely used app
  • Strong mobile development culture.
  • You know how to make integration testing less painful (XCTests, FBSnapshots).
  • Strong understanding of the iOS SDK (UIKit, MapKit).
  • Ability to thrive in a startup environment.

BONUS POINTS

  • Contributions to open source projects.
  • Experience with RxSwift.

PERKS

  • Permanent contract
  • Stock.
  • Paid conference attendance/travel and periodic team meetups.
  • Heetch credits.
  • A Spotify subscription.
  • Work from anywhere you want.

Benefits

Full remote (in Europe only) and flexible ways of working
Paid conferences attendance/travel
Periodic team meetups
Stocks
Heetch credits

DRIVER EXPERIENCE TEAM @HEETCH

The top priority of our user-driven team is the happiness of our drivers. From the moment they decide to join us until they enter our marketplace, drivers will be using our products. And our mission is to make sure they get the stellar experience they deserve.

Given our very large business scope(drivers acquisition, retention and well-being), our team is working side by side with frontend, mobile, product and design teams, allowing us to build features that will empower drivers with new ways to drive and earn.

From the inside, we’re a caring full-stack team of engineers(IOS, Android, Frontend, Backend, QA) who share the same values:

• Transparency: We discuss everything openly.

With the many new challenges we’re facing every day, our team is seeking a product aficionado that will help us take our services to the next level. Our ideal candidate is someone who loves building softwares people genuinely love using, have strong problem-solving skills and great empathy for users.

What Happens Next Will Surprise You !

CHALLENGES YOU’LL BE FACING WITH US

RESPONSIBILITIES

items.title: Full Stack Developer @ AdBlock, serving 60 million users... at AdBlock ()
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Cybersecurity, Digital Advertising, Digital Media
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

About Us

We are a small team that services the needs of tens of millions of users. We strive to ensure that our users have complete control over their online browsing experience. Our main product, AdBlock, is one of the most popular browser extensions in history and has been downloaded more than 200 million times by users all over the world.  Our products work in all major browsers, including Chrome, Safari, Firefox and Edge, as well as on Apple iOS and Android devices.

We are a distributed team in the United States. While we have a small office in San Francisco, most of our employees work remotely and this role can either be situated in San Francisco, or remotely, depending on what works best for the person that fills it. What unites us is a desire to make it easier and safer for users to surf the Web.


About You
Our development cycle is extremely fast. It's common to write code and have it running in production just a few hours later. If you work for us, you will make an impact, immediately.

AdBlock is seeking software engineers to join our engineering team that are willing to roll up their sleeves and contribute in a number of areas. You can help create web applications that reach millions of people, build high volume servers and be a part of a team that’s reaching tens of millions of AdBlock users.

What You Will Do:

  • Develop new web-based tools and applications to support AdBlock's continued growth as an extension, and as a family of services
  • Maintain and improve the getadblock.com website by writing clean, well-documented code
  • Create and execute QA scripts, test plans, and testing frameworks for popular desktop extensions and the AdBlock website viewed by tens of millions of people
  • Work with design, business development, and customer support to help solve complex user and partner-related product questions

Minimum Qualifications

  • Motivated, intellectually curious, and ready to contribute in multiple areas on a small team
  • Ability to pick up new programming languages, frameworks and APIs quickly
  • High levels of creativity and solid problem-solving abilities
  • Preferred: Python, PHP, or Node.js experience
  • Preferred: HTML, Javascript, and CSS experience
  • Preferred: Demonstrated software engineering experience from previous internship, work experience or an online portfolio (e.g., GitHub)
  • Ability to obtain and maintain work authorization in the United States.

If you are interested in applying, please send resumes and links to your work to careers@getadblock.com. AdBlock is not able to sponsor, obtain, and/or petition for temporary visa status for this role.

About AdBlock

We are a small team that services the needs of tens of millions of users. We strive to ensure that our users have complete control over their online browsing experience. Our main product, AdBlock, is one of the most popular browser extensions in history and has been downloaded more than 200 million times by users all over the world.  Our products work in all major browsers, including Chrome, Safari, Firefox, and Edge, as well as on Apple iOS and Android devices.

We are a distributed team. While we have a small office in San Francisco, most of our employees work remotely and this role can either be situated in San Francisco or remotely, depending on what works best for the person that fills it. What unites us is a desire to make it easier and safer for users to surf the Web.

Benefits

Work remotely
Flexible hours
Startup culture, without the funding woes
MacBook Pro or PC, and equipment you need to be effective at your job
401K + company matching

We're looking for a new employee in our small team (only engineers, eight people) and give you the opportunity to be part of our very exciting journey.

You are a Senior iOS Engineer with strong experience, and you will be an essential part of our lean and focused company. The position is full-time. This is an excellent career opportunity to join a fast growing 100% remote company in a key position.

Jaumo is one of the fastest growing dating apps worldwide with more than 30 million members in over 180 countries. The app for Android and iOS is available in 59 languages and among the Top #5 dating apps in many countries. We connect people. For fun. For love. For life.

Our company is bootstrapped and operated by just the two founders. We're not a start-up anymore, and we have proven that we built a sustainable business in a fast-growing, competitive and profitable sector.

items.title: (Remote) Senior Backend Developer at Mixtiles ()
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Design, Photography, Retail
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Our Backend

We believe that in business, being amazing in software development creates huge advantages. That’s why Mixtiles relies heavily on software. Our product is affordable because software automates our factory. Our marketing scales because software collects tons of data from various sources and aggregates it into actionable dashboards. Our customers love how we communicate with them because software automates tons of the emails we’re sending in a smart way. Our backend controls almost every aspect of the company, it has a huge influence over everything we do.

What will you do?

You will own the backend. You’ll make the API amazing for the iOS and Android devs. You’ll improve our customer services interface, make our responses better and faster. You’ll improve the way our factory works, and enable our expansion to new countries. A lot of our decisions are based on data, you’ll collect that data and crunch it so our CEO and VPs could guide the ship to the right direction. We don’t do bureaucracy or politics. If you’re fast, you’ll fly.

Who should you be?

You’re a fast, smart coder with an eye for simplicity. You’ve been writing code for more than 5 years. You’re super fun to talk to, and people frequently feel they’ve learned something after talking to you. You’re passionate about software development and are constantly open to new paradigms and ideas. You care about quality and testing, but don’t go overboard. You’re responsible and understand that if the backend crashes, so do most of the company’s operations. You speak good English. You’re a good person that believes in the good of others. We'll put together an offer based on your skill and experience. It will be the best offer you'll get. We take quality very seriously, and we're willing to pay for great people when we find them. You'll work from home. (Or we'll rent some office space for you if you prefer that.) It's an exciting time for Mixtiles. We're pumped to read your application, and hope to have you on board.

About Mixtiles

What is Mixtiles?

We’re helping people put photos on walls. Canvas prints and framed photos are OLD products that haven’t seen innovation in years. We’re using software, industrial design and operational excellence to re-design the entire experience, starting from your phone. Check out our apps (iOS, Android) and our video!

Benefits

100% Remote
Unlimited vacation
Flexible hours
Paid maternity/paternity leave
Equal opportunity

items.title: iOS Engineer
items.content:
iOS Engineer at Stop, Breathe & Think, PBC

Santa Monica, Remote · Full Time
Skills
iOS Development, Objective-C, Swift
Compensation
$70K–$100K
0.25%–0.5%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

iOS Engineer

At Stop, Breathe & Think, our mission is to inspire the world to practice mental wellness every day. We believe that taking a few minutes each day to feel the calm is as important as regular exercise, and if we can help more people regularly find peace of mind, we’re doing our part to help make the world a better place. Our award winning meditation app tailors meditations based on user emotions. With its friendly, simple and accessible experience, it has become a top ranked app for meditation and mindfulness and garnered over 2 million downloads.

We recently joined Amplify LA, a startup accelerator in Venice, California. Part of our team is based at the Amplify offices, and the rest work remotely. As we ramp up our team, we're looking for great iOS engineers who are excited about building awesome products and care about our mission. This is an opportunity to join an early stage company that has already built a large organic audience in a fast growing category and help define the user experience for the space.

Responsibilities:

Work with UX designers, product managers, and company founders to plan and implement new features and capabilities

Expand our existing iOS application, https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/id778848692

Build new apps from the ground up as we expand

Mentor interns and more junior developers

Work with our API engineers to plan and integrate server-side support for the apps and features you build

Requirements:

3+ years of experience developing iOS apps in Objective C and Swift

Can work in an agile, JIRA-based environment
Have shipped an app where you were a significant contributor
Experience using Auto Layout from code (we use Masonry)

A bonus if you have experience with any of the following:

Audio and video streaming
Swift
In-app purchases and subscriptions
Building apps for a large, diverse user base

On-site preferred, remote ok as long as you can work during US Pacific Time working hours.

Compensation: Competitive Salary + Equity

items.title: Android Software Engineer
items.content:
*What you'll do*
You will join the product team working at PopJam and its SDK.
*PopJam* is the world’s leading kid-safe social content platform used by top brands and YouTubers in the US, UK and Canada including Nintendo, Disney, Kellogg’s and many others.

You will ensure all product components are built to an appropriate level of quality for the stage (alpha/beta/production), delivered using the appropriate agile project management methodology, learning & iterating frequently, and work with the Product Manager to define the roadmap for any given feature and translate this into user stories

Here's what a day as a Mobile Engineer looks like:
* Work with team members to design and implement new features for the products
* Commit to high-speed iterations, high code quality, and continuous improvement via agile processes
* Provide production support, system diagnosis and troubleshooting
* Support and be a critical part our Mobile dev-ops culture (CI/CD, release train and progressive rollout, SDK updates)

*About you*
_Personality wise_
You’re a fire-starter who can clearly demonstrate your ability to be proactive without direct supervision.
You like working in an agile development environment and get stuff done together with your team.
You're flexible and adaptable, to changing situations and responsibilities.

_Skillset wise_
You are proficient in native mobile development on Android (Kotlin and Java), and you have experience with the full lifecycle of a mobile application and its components.
You developed, maintained, and supported large and complex mobile applications and components serving large userbases.

*_Some_ technologies we use*
Kotlin, Java, Gradle, JUnit, Appium

*About Us*
SuperAwesome (@GoSuperAwesome) is the largest kids’ digital media platform in the world, reaching over *500M kids each month* across mobile, web and online video. The company’s technology powers the global kids’ digital media ecosystem, ensuring kid-safe advertising, safe-social, family authentication and COPPA compliance for hundreds of brands and agencies around the world including LEGO, Warner Bros, Hasbro, Disney, Nintendo, Cartoon Network and many others.

*About Our Products*
*AwesomeAds* is the industry’s leading kid-safe, COPPA-compliant ad platform used by hundreds of brands and agencies in the UK, US, Australia and Southeast Asia.
*REX* is the world’s first and only kid-safe, compliant programmatic solution empowering brands to engage with kids via their existing programmatic infrastructure while remaining fully compliant with COPPA and GDPR.
*PopJam* is the world’s leading kid-safe social content platform used by top brands and YouTubers in the US, UK and Canada including Nintendo, Disney, Kellogg’s and many others.
*Kids Web Services (KWS)* provides compliance-as-a-service tools for kids’ content creators and is used by companies like Hasbro, Hachette and Walker Books to power international, kid-safe sites and apps.

This is a big challenge that will allow you to use the latest Android technologies such as Kotlin, Functional programming, Reactive architectures to deliver apps that serve tens of thousands of users daily.

*What we offer*
You’ll be joining a rapidly growing team having recently closed their Series B investment with a lot of experience, a serious track record and an awesome team atmosphere. You'll have a genuine opportunity to learn and grow through clear direction and hands on mentorship from an experienced Senior Management team. You'll also get hands on experience leading our communities and reporting insights to the wider team and clients.
Salary and package will be competitive and commensurate with experience.

*FAQ*
* Q: Are you open to remote work?
* A: Yes, we are very flexible with remote work. We have people commuting in a few times a week from outside London as well as people flying in a week each month from abroad. To facilitate cooperation we are limiting our team's timezones to UTC (London time) to UTC+2 (Eastern European time).

* Q: Which team is this position open for?
* A: Currently we are hiring for all the product teams. Our hiring process aims to get a clear picture of your strengths and weaknesses, so once you're onboard you will join the team that fits your skills the most.

* Q: What does the interviewing process look like?
* A: Our process starts with a code test assignment to do on your own, then you'll have a videocall with our engineers to discuss your implementation, and eventually you will be invited for an on-site interview.

* Q: I don't know Kotlin/[specific framework], should I apply anyway?
* A: We believe a good engineer can pick up any new technology in a reasonable amount of time, therefore you can use any language you're familiar with for completing the codetest. As soon as you join you will have an onboarding plan tailored around you, challenging and bringing you up to speed.

items.title: Crazy Android Developer
items.content:
Crazy Android Developer at ListUp

Bengaluru, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
₹800K–₹1800K
0.1%–1.0%

Job Description

“A smart a** team, building a kick a** product, in a big a** market”
Thats us.
We are crazy and we are passionate.

We have already begun our journey to transform re-commerce industry using technology. With laser sharp focus on technology, we are developing a state-of-the-art product that is unmatched in history. Some say, build a 10x better product. We say, build an incomparable one.

So why we are dealing with the problem of people being unable to buy&sell among themselves? Because it has a huge impact; not just because it makes our lives easier but also because it can transform our lives. Think of someone who does not have the resources to buy a book he needs for his exams. What if you have it? For you, it maybe an unused item, for him it is the dream.

So to build an amazing solution, we are looking for Android Application Developer who loves facing challenges head-on and work crazily to solve them. Plus, you get to work with some of the best minds in the country to make a major dent in the 100 billion dollar resale goods industry!

Desired Skills:

- Strong understanding of Object Oriented Programming, data structures and design patterns
- Strong Java programming skills
- Knowledge of software development processes & agile methodologies
- Strong problem solving and debugging skills
- Experience working with the Eclipse IDE/Android Studio
- Understanding of DB Design

Desired Experience:

- Experience in developing android applications
- Expertise in implementation of custom UI components
- Experience working with Google Maps, Image Compression, Chat, Social APIs
- Experience in memory management and in designing high-performance apps
- Working knowledge of Android SDK and Android Development Tools
- Experience in shipping applications through the Google play store
- Experience with analytics tools like Google Analytics, Flurry
- Well versed with mobile UI/UX conventions
- Experience in using GIT or other version control systems.

Let's do it!

items.title: iOS Engineer
items.content:
iOS Engineer at Heetch

Paris, Remote · Full Time
Skills
iOS Development, Unit Testing, Swift, RxSwift
Compensation
€50K–€60K
0.5%–1.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

http://jobs.heetch.com/o/ios-engineer-paris

*** We offer flexible and full remote work over Europe.
We are not ready yet to work with people outside EU but will keep you posted on that ;) ***

Simply put, we aim at offering the most playful ridesharing experience for party-goers, and the most satisfying night out for drivers. Our app is the centerpiece of the whole service, where drivers are able to get ride requests, where passengers are able to request rides, and where everyone is able to get in touch with us directly at anytime.

We don’t want to see our users open up Heetch just because we can get them from point A to point B, we want them to open the app because they feel like it was specifically built for them. We want to build upon our core service everything that would make every ride enjoyable. Whether it’s helping them put the music passengers want to listen to, help drivers find the right spots to go to and the right ride, give recommandations about places passengers would want to go, and it’s all open for anyone to suggest.

OUR ENGINEERING VALUES
• Move smart: we are data driven, and employ tools and best practices to ship code quickly and safely (continuous integration, code review, automated testing, etc).
• Distribute knowledge: we want to scale our engineering team to a point where our contributions do not stop at the company code base. We believe in the Open Source culture and communication with the outside world.
• Leave code better than you found it: because we constantly raise the bar.
• Unity makes strength: moving people from A to B is not as easy as it sounds but, we always keep calm and support each other.
• Always improve: we value personal progress and want you to look back proudly on what you’ve done.

MOBILE AT HEETCH
Our app is one of the few mobile apps that run in the foreground for up to seven hours straight on drivers phones. This rather unique use case brings fun challenges with handling the lifecycle of the app.

Network and GPS management: we need to provide accurate information and price suggestions to our community. This means making sure every driver gets important notifications in any network conditions, provide as accurate as possible GPS localisation for the pricing and tracking.
UI & UX: Ride sharing apps are a really special case in app design. They all revolve around a map and the conventional navigation patterns like list view and navigation controls need heavy tweaking to make for a great user experience.
One way data flow and functional pattern: we are passionate about software architecture. We’ve built the core of our apps using Rx and want to push this forward in both the data and the UI layers. Ideally, our team will grow big enough that we’ll be able to push forward what doing mobile programming means and we’ll contribute back to all those amazing open source projects we learned from.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
• Build new exciting features.
• Solve challenging real-time synchronization problems.
• Build a robust & modern in-house framework, that will serve our app for next 4 years
• Practise continuous refactoring and unit testing to constantly improve the codebase.
• Create custom UI components (with Playground Driven Development)
• Work on our great shiny redesign of the app.
• Experimenting with various concepts (Coordinators/Flows, ReSwift)

REQUIREMENTS
• Great oral and written communication skills.
• At least 3-4 years of experience with both Objective C and Swift in production environments.
• Strong mobile development culture.
• You know how to make integration testing less painful (XCTests, FBSnapshots).
• Strong understanding of the iOS SDK (UIKit, MapKit).
• Ability to thrive in a startup environment.

BONUS POINTS
• Contributions to open source projects.
• Experience with RxSwift.

PERKS
• Permanent contract (CDI).
• Stock.
• Paid conference attendance/travel and periodic team meetups.
• Heetch credits.

items.title: Senior Android Engineer @ Bread
items.content:
Senior Android Engineer @ Bread

2018-01-08 03:43

Description

We are looking for an experienced Android engineer to join our mobile team to help us build the best crypto currency experience in the world. Our vision is to decentralize banking and bring the power of financial services to everyone in the world, including the nearly 2 billion adults that to this day remain unbanked.

Android At Bread

Android is a first class citizen at Bread. As our fastest growing platform, Android is core to our business at Bread. With the release of our redesign, our Android app is fully up to speed with our product release schedule and new features are pushed at the same time as our iOS app.

We're committed to building one of the best Android apps out there, not just the best wallet or crypto currency app. Our goal is to expand our Android customer base to meet or exceed that of our iOS app so we can bring the safety and security of our app model to millions of Android customers.

Our Android engineers get the unique advantage of being able to target devices that support Marshmallow or newer, streamlining the developer experience, and cutting out a lot of backward compatibility cruft typical of Android development.

What we're doing at Bread

Bread is at the heart of a financial revolution. We're building the missing piece of infrastructure that ties together the essential functionality of a bank, but where individuals retain complete control over their assets. As a a financial infrastructure company, our mission is unlikely to ever be complete. We need continually strive to bring the power of our apps to new regions of the world, some of which have never had wide access to banking functionality.

Our approach to this problem heavily focuses on several core tenants. For one, we will never have direct control or visibility over customer funds. It is not our job to interfere in the personal financial lives of our customers. This is accomplished by using digital assets like Bitcoin, and a mobile app like ours which manages its assets on-device.

The second tenant of our approach is to provide integration with the traditional financial system. Regardless of the currency, people still need to get paid, pay their bills, pay for goods at merchants, and send money to their family and friends. We are building infrastructure that integrates with local financial businesses that tie in with local currencies and adhere to local laws.

Finally, we need to fight for a quality consumer experience. This is why we try to retain control over every moment of our customer's interaction with our products. We relentlessly design, redesign, test, and experiment to ensure our customers have a positive, safe experience.

What it's like to work here

We've built a lively remote work culture that emphasizes regular personal interaction. At Bread, we started as a remote team and have built our workflows around it. This allows us to hire people who want to work with us, regardless of where they've decided to settle (or roam).

Work-life balance is important to everyone at Bread, and we strive to ensure everyone has enough time for family, exercise, and mental health. In our opinion, a happy and healthy team is an essential ingredient to finding creative solutions to the hard problems we're trying to solve.

We're more operationally transparent than you may be used to. The entire Bread team has access to a variety of dashboards that help our distributed team make better decisions. If you have a question that can't be answered by a dashboard or an easy query, let's see if we can fix that.

Bread is committed to building an actively inclusive work environment that makes our team an excellent home for everyone—regardless of gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, education, age, or other personal characteristics.

Requirements

There are no hard requirements, so if you see something listed here that you're unsure about, please don't hesitate to ask!

  • 5+ years of software engineering experience
  • Confidence working in the Android ecosystem: Android Studio, debugging
  • Familiarity writing portable apps that work on a variety of devices
  • Ability to write unit tests, integration tests
  • Knowledge of web technologies: APIs, HTTP, JSON, etc
  • A desire to learn and grow your skills
  • You value your attention to detail

Nice to haves:

  • Experience with C and embedded development is a big plus
  • Crypto currency experience will help you get up to speed quicker

You should include these in your application:

  • Resume and LinkedIn profile
  • Links to code samples on Github, Gitlab, etc

Country

Anywhere*

Location

USA/Canada/Mexico

items.title: Senior iOS Engineer @ Bread
items.content:
Senior iOS Engineer @ Bread

2018-01-08 03:42

Description

We are looking for an experienced iOS engineer to join our mobile team to help us build the best crypto currency experience in the world. Our vision is to decentralize banking and bring the power of financial services to everyone in the world, including the nearly 2 billion adults that to this day remain unbanked.

iOS at Bread

Bread started out on iOS so the Apple ecosystem is in our blood. Originally, our entire Bitcoin stack was written from scratch in Objective-C. We've since evolved our business and product significantly, however iOS remains core to our ability to execute on our vision. We're not a mobile-first company, we're mobile-only. Our mobile apps are the only way our customers interact with Bread, so we take great pride in our apps.

The Bread app on iOS is responsible for securing billions of USD worth of digital assets, and that number continues to grow every day. We're growing our iOS team so we can expand our product portfolio and support our rapidly growing iOS customer base.

Regardless of the currency, people still need to get paid, pay their bills, pay for goods at merchants, and send money to their family and friends. We are building infrastructure that integrates with local financial businesses that tie in with local currencies and adhere to local laws.

Finally, we need to fight for a quality consumer experience. This is why we try to retain control over every moment of our customer's interaction with our products. We relentlessly design, redesign, test, and experiment to ensure our customers have a positive, safe experience.

What it's like to work here

We've built a lively remote work culture that emphasizes regular personal interaction. At Bread, we started as a remote team and have built our workflows around it. This allows us to hire people who want to work with us, regardless of where they've decided to settle (or roam).

Work-life balance is important to everyone at Bread, and we strive to ensure everyone has enough time for family, exercise, and mental health. In our opinion, a happy and healthy team is an essential ingredient to finding creative solutions to the hard problems we're trying to solve.

We're more operationally transparent than you may be used to. The entire Bread team has access to a variety of dashboards that help our distributed team make better decisions. If you have a question that can't be answered by a dashboard or an easy query, let's see if we can fix that.

Bread is committed to building an actively inclusive work environment that makes our team an excellent home for everyone—regardless of gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, education, age, or other personal characteristics.

Requirements

There are no hard requirements, so if you see something listed here that you're unsure about, please don't hesitate to ask!

  • 5+ years of software engineering experience
  • Confidence working in the iOS ecosystem: Xcode, debugging
  • Some experience with Swift
  • Ability to write unit tests, integration tests
  • Knowledge of web technologies: APIs, HTTP, JSON, etc
  • A desire to learn and grow your skills
  • You value your attention to detail

Nice to haves:

  • Experience with C and embedded development is a big plus
  • Crypto currency experience will help you get up to speed quicker
  • Graphics programming and animations

You should include these in your application:

  • Resume and LinkedIn profile
  • Links to code samples on Github, Gitlab, etc

Country

Anywhere*

Location

USA/Canada/Mexico

items.title: Game Changer MVP: Software Architect & Interactive Director
items.content:
Software Architect & Interactive Director

Posted Jan 6

Game Changer MVP
Headquarters: Dallas, TX
www.gcmvp.com


DUTIES &RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

·      Software Design - Game Changerapplications are multiple pieces of software that are interconnected. Designeach individual component (detailing the behaviors the component should have),define the ways in which those components communicate, and compile thisinformations into a formal document This ‘spec sheet’ is given to eachdevelopment team to implement

 

·      DevOps - Code pushed to Git repositoriesis automatically built and deployed via a CI/CD system (CircleCI). Monitor thehealth of already created applications, and design new systems of continuousintegration and deployment to meet the needs of new applications

 

 

·      Release Management - While mostapplications are deployed to the web or embedded in other applications, othersare built to be release on the App/Play store. Know the release process of bothiOS and Android platforms

 

·      Code Review - New code will be submitteddaily by developers. It should be checked for errors and that it follows bestpractices

 

·      Client Communication - Strongcommunication skills to work with engineers from other companies, as GameChanger applications are often integrated into other companies products andapplications

·      Staff Management - Manages software and development staff in day to day operationsalong with weekly calls and oversight of deadlines and deliverables

·      Internal Communication – Handles updates to all Game Changer staff relevantto deadlines, software and app updates, new game development and otherinteractive items as required

 

 

JOB REQUIRMENTS:

 

  • Minimum of a 4-year Bachelor’s degree or educational equivalent
  • High level communication skills dealing with internal and external parties
  • Strong personnel management, communication, time management and organizational skills. 
  • Proven ability to multi-task and manage projects on strict deadlines
  • Has had previous experience and possesses intermediate to advanced skills in Microsoft Office, Google Docs, and Gmail Suite
  • Excellent ability to work with and maintain positive work relationships with co-workers, managers, and executives and clients
  • Able to work flexible hours including evening, weekend, holidays as needed
  • Professional image and demeanor
  • Some travel to meet and work with clients or set up/work events
  • Possess very high degree of discretion and professionalism
·      Required proficiencies: Angular (notAngular1/AngularJS), Typescript, Git
·      Technologies used that will need to be learned:Pubnub, Google Cloud Platform, CircleCI, GitHub, Electron, Firebase
·      Additionally, Unreal Engine experience ishelpful but not necessary
 

The perfect candidate is a self-starter who knows how to manage a team of people.  Previous game development and/or app development experience a must, basic knowledge of Unreal, Unity, JSON, IOS and Android Structure also is a plus. This is full time position that will allow for remote working. Our company is a virtual office where everyone works around the US and internationally.

Apply for this position

Send a resume to shopkins@gcmvp.com

items.title: Advant Interactive: App Developer with iOS and Android Experience
items.content:
Part-time

(Long Beach, CA)

We are Advant Interactive, a group of design and developer nerds. We’re a small bunch so far but we have plans for world domination. We’re based in Long Beach, just a Kobe 3-pointer from the beach, and a taxi ride from the heart of LA. We are on the lookout for an individual who seeks a position at the cutting edge of web development. All candidates must work with speed and enjoy sweating over tight deadlines. They must live to code and not be happy until they’ve seen a project through from insemination to birth to that first day at kindergarten.

 

Who are you? The dude (or dudette) for the role should have a minimum of 4 years in the world of iOS and Android app development, with a portfolio that’s likely to blow our socks off.

Because we live in the virtual world, it does not matter where you reside, as long as you are available during business hours. Still reading?

 

Can you tick these boxes?

● You have at least 4 years' experience in app development.

● You have a strong understanding of iOS and Android frameworks.

● You have extensive knowledge of iOS, Java, Swift, Objective C, and other languages for iOS and Android app development.

● You can provide us with current examples of your work -- let us know what we can download from the App store.

● You're in the know and stay current on technology standards, industry trends, emerging technologies, and software development best practices.

● You care about coding the right way and not taking shortcuts.

● Web development experience is a plus!

● You have experience working with remote teams.

● You possess strong judgment, analytical, and problem-solving skills.

 

And it goes without saying You can both talk the talk and walk the walk. You have 20:20 vision when it comes to fine details. You consider missing a deadline one of the seven deadly sins. If you’ve gotten this far, you could be just what we’re looking for. Send us your portfolio and we’ll talk.

 

Job Perks: Work remotely!

Apply: 1. Send us links to your best apps in the App Store/Google Play Store.2. Let us know your location.3. Please indicate your freelance hourly rate.4. Provide your current availability.

items.title: Software Developer (Xamarin) at exeGesIS at exeGesIS (Brecon, UK)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: IT Consulting, Software Consulting, Software Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Brecon Beacons (Option for remote working) – Due to the location of this role (Brecon Beacons National Park in Powys, Wales), exegesis are considering applicants from right across the UK and therefore there are remote options for this role

Who are we?

exeGesIS is a well-established and respected software consultancy with an impressive portfolio of information management applications used in the environmental and conservation sectors. In the last few months alone we have been working on dozens of interesting projects for clients including Natural England, the RNLI, the National Trust, Central Government, English Heritage, The Ramblers, many local authorities, Wildlife Trusts and the Church of England. In fact most of the major UK conservation and land management organisations are regular clients and we also have a number of important conservation clients overseas, particularly in N. Europe.

We are a continuously growing Conservation Management organisation that has been taking the environmental sector by storm and we are looking for dynamic, like-minded individuals to join us on our journey. The real challenge will be to keep up with the demand from new clients and using the latest tech, to develop components, services and web applications that will help shape our operations moving forward.

With this continuous growth, we are now currently looking for top-class Developers to join our team in Brecon, where you will be working within a cross-skilled, agile team, developing maintainable, efficient software applications.

As a Xamarin Developer, you will work in a team of highly skilled Developers, Testers and Product Owners to design and develop web/mobile applications for Geographical Information Systems.

This is a fantastic opportunity to get on board with a very established company with a great brand and reputation.

More specifically, you will:

  • Have sound knowledge of mobile design principles
  • Be experienced with C# and the Xamarin SDK, with particular experience delivering iOS and Android apps using Xamarin Forms
  • Be familiar with RESTful APIs to connect mobile applications to back-end services
  • Have built, or helped build several, operational Xamarin apps

 And any of the following would be a bonus:

  • Experience of developing Xamarin apps using location services and mapping
  • Web application development: ASP.Net MVC and/or ASP.Net WebForms.

We have great salaries and the opportunity to progress, also, with a brilliant benefits package on offer including the option of overtime and supported remote working.

About exeGesIS

We are a well-established and respected software consultancy with an impressive portfolio of predominantly mapping and database applications used in the environmental and conservation sectors.  We have no marketing or sales staff and our continued growth (we presently have 36 staff) is based largely on the recommendation of existing clients.

We are a Microsoft Partner and so work predominantly, but not exclusively, with Microsoft technologies.  We also make extensive use of open source software and tools, particularly around mapping. In the end we simply decide on the most appropriate tools for the particular project and the particular client.

In the last few months alone we have been working on dozens of interesting projects for clients including Natural England, RNLI, National Trust, Central Government, RCAHMW, The Ramblers, many local authorities, Wildlife Trusts and the Church of England! More information about the company can be found on our website at www.esdm.co.uk

Why work with us?

  • We have great clients doing great work for wildlife, conservation and communities. We enjoy building tools to help them and they seem to like what we do
  • We are not big on hierarchies and role division and although already agile, we are always advancing our approach to build better products and have happier teams
  • You really will have the opportunity to refine your role around your own strengths and interests; if you want to meet clients, design, code and deliver all aspects end-to-end, then we will have projects for you. Or, if you prefer to code with the door firmly shut, then we still have a place for you
  • We are based in a National Park - a great location if you value countryside, outdoor activities and avoiding life-wasting commutes. And you can also work remotely for at least some of the time
  • Don’t be fooled by the cuddly nature of our clients and their work. Typically they require (and we give) a lot for their money and that drives creativity, efficiency and sheer hard work. We see this as a positive

 We are looking for?

We need more developers (web mainly, but desktop or mobile experience is also useful). We would like to work with people who are:

  • Passionate and enthusiastic about software development and technology in general

You enjoy coding. You love working out how to solve a problem with an elegant solution.  You read techie blogs, may attend user groups and time allowing, you may well have personal side projects

  • Smart (more so than your average bear)

You probably* have a good academic background, you may well have evolved to become an IT professional from another discipline and could probably work out the Rubik’s cube solution algorithms – if you had to

*We also have great developers that have found non-academic routes into the profession

  • Positive and problem solving

Well that’s the core of application development so not only do you take pride in finding solutions, you are also sufficiently self-aware to know when to stop digging, when to ask for help and when to keep going ‘ because ‘you’re nearly there 

  • Self-motivated/organised/disciplined

Benefits

Contributory Pension
Childcare Vouchers
In house tech training
Extended holiday scheme
Cycle to Work
Very flexible working hours with home working options
Company socials
A peaceful village location in a National Park - no rush hour!
